What makes our in-house installation team experts?

  • Experienced City & Guilds accredited electrictions.*
  • Rigerous training on electric vehicles & how to charge them.
  • Thousands of hours of real world experience installing EV chargepoints across the UK.

*City & Guilds 2382-15 17th Edition Course

Your chargepoint installation

Our experts go the extra mile to provide the best installation experience in the UK.

Your install is included free with your chargepoint if it meets our standard install criteria.

Pre-arrival

Your expert will confirm their arrival time with you in advance of the installation.

Pre-installation

Your expert will find the best position for your charger based on your power supply and how you park your car.

Installation

Your expert will position and fix the charger to the wall making sure it's ready to use.

Demonstration

Your expert will provide a full demonstration of your charger, what the different lights mean and how to get in touch if you have any questions later on.

Finally they'll make sure you know how to find & use public chargepoints in your area and answer any other questions you have about charging.

Install terms

Your install is included in the price of the chargepoint if it meets our standard install criteria.

If it doesn’t, we’ll provide a no obligation quote or a full refund if you don’t want to proceed.

View installation terms

Standard Install

Our standard install for the homecharge POD Point covers the majority of home installs in the UK and includes:

  • Install of POD Point on a brick or plaster wall, or suitable permanent structure.
  • The fitting of correct electrical connections and protections.
  • An additional three way consumer unit, if required.
  • Up to 15 metres of cable, run between the distribution board/electricity meter and the POD Point.
  • The cable run will be clipped flush to the wall at a height of no more than 6ft, running above the ground.
  • Up to 15 metres of cable, run between the distribution board/electricity meter and the POD Point.
  • The cable run will be clipped flush to the wall at a height of no more than 6ft, running above the ground.
  • Cable run through a single wal, l no thicker than half a metre.
  • An earth rod in soft ground, if required.

Please note:

  • We assume that your electrical connection is in adequate condition and has sufficient available capacity.

What happens if you need extra works carried out?

  • Photos sent in advance: Work out a customer quote for any additional works.
  • Minor additional works: new quote issued on site, payment taken and work completed on same day (discount offered if quote is accepted on the same day).
  • Significant additional works: engineer site survey on day then project manager will contact within 5 working days with new quote.
  • In all of the above, if you choose not to go ahead you can get a full refund.

Are you eligible for the EVHS OLEV Grant?

  • Do you have off-street parking and a plug-in vehicle pur chased after April 2015?
  • If you answered yes, its likely you will qualify for a government grant that offers EV drivers £500 off the cost of purchasing and installing a home chargepoint.
  • You’re in good hands as we will claim the grant on your behalf so you can spend more time driving.
  • Don’t have off-street parking don’t worry OLEV offers local authorities the On-Street Residential Chargepoint Scheme for EV drivers that don’t have off-street parking facilities

Tech Specs

Universal Unit

If you change/upgrade your EV to a different Type ie. Type 1 to 2 you will just need to purchase a cable or a cable might be supplied with the car.

Tethered Unit

This is a convenient option as the 4.8m cable is attached to the unit.

View tech specs

Phases

Single and three phase options

Rated Output

3.6kW

7kW

22kW

Connectors

SAE J1772 connector

IEC 62196 connector

Size

Dimensions: 360mm, depth = 150mm

Weight: 6.5kg

Colour

Black and Grey

Features
  • The status of the charge point is shown by coloured status lights.
  • Communicating variants of the chargepoint are compatible with the POD Point MIS.

Warranty

We have got you covered with maintenance and support for 3 years at no extra cost. If your POD Point smart charger is broken one of our experts will come over and fix it, if it can’t be fixed we will swop the unit for another one.

Safety

Our chargepoints are designed and tested using BS EN 61010 & BS EN 61557 approved equipment to meet the following European safety & functionality standards for electrical devices.

The POD Point chargepoint also provides internal over-current protection in addition to the other safety features.
